column5: Sânziene is a Romanian tradition linked to midsummer
column7: magical rituals. Yearly celebrations feature customs like flower-picking

label: Baobhan sith
column5: The baobhan sith are vampiric fairies from Scottish folklore
column6: known for luring travelers or hunters in remote Highland areas with their beauty before draining their life force.

label: Leanan sídhe
column5: The Leanan sídhe is a fairy from Irish folklore
column6: often depicted as a beautiful muse who inspires artists and poets while draining their life force
column7: leading to genius and early death.

label: Ircenrraat
column6: also known as “Ddhaw Dana” or the “little people
column7: ” are small humanlike beings believed to inhabit the remote mountains and caves of Lake Clark National Park. Known for their mischievous nature

column9: leaving them hopelessly lost in the wilderness.

longitude: -1.9743419426551276 The Weardale Fairies https://www.thisisdurham.com/inspire-me/durhams-unmissable-highlights/legends-of-durham/the-weardale-fairies In an old Northumbrian tale
label: a farmer’s daughter wandered far from home
link: drawn by distant laughter until she peered through a crack in a rock and saw fairies dancing within. Terrified
column5: she fled back to the farm
column6: but her parents knew that no mortal saw the fairies without them coming after her
column7: and a local wise woman warned that they would return at midnight. The family tried to keep the house utterly silent
column8: but the farm dog barked as the fairies arrived and
column10: the girl vanished. Only by bringing three curious gifts—a glow-worm for light without fire
column12: and an unboned chick within a newly laid egg—could her father appease the little folk. #approx
